post.description: This API deletes multiple records permanently.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of records to be fetched

schema.description: Number of records to be fetched

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Key that returns the values of mentioned fields (both pre-defined and custom) in your portal. All field types except multi-text are supported. Standard, non-editable fields are supported too. Maximum of 30 fields is supported as comma separated values.

schema.description: Key that returns the values of mentioned fields (both pre-defined and custom) in your portal. All field types except multi-text are supported. Standard, non-editable fields are supported too. Maximum of 30 fields is supported as comma separated values.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
A filter expression is a query parameter used to filter records from a database based on specific conditions. This filter applies to selected fields within the records and allows you to retrieve only those records that meet the specified criteria. The filter expression is constructed using logical operators, relational operators, and functions to define conditions on one or more fields in the dataset.

A filter expression helps to retrieve specific records from the database by applying conditions to selected fields.

It uses logical operators (like AND, OR), comparison operators (like =, >, <, >=, <=, !=), and functions (like .contains(), .isEmpty(), .isNotEmpty()) to match records that meet your criteria.

Supported comparison operators:
<, >, <=, >=, =, !=

Supported functions:
isEmpty
isNotEmpty
contains

For example:

productCode != 12345 AND quantity = 100OR category.contains('electronics') AND discount.isNotEmpty()

schema.description:
A filter expression is a query parameter used to filter records from a database based on specific conditions. This filter applies to selected fields within the records and allows you to retrieve only those records that meet the specified criteria. The filter expression is constructed using logical operators, relational operators, and functions to define conditions on one or more fields in the dataset.

A filter expression helps to retrieve specific records from the database by applying conditions to selected fields.

It uses logical operators (like AND, OR), comparison operators (like =, >, <, >=, <=, !=), and functions (like .contains(), .isEmpty(), .isNotEmpty()) to match records that meet your criteria.

Supported comparison operators:
<, >, <=, >=, =, !=

Supported functions:
isEmpty
isNotEmpty
contains

For example:

productCode != 12345 AND quantity = 100OR category.contains('electronics') AND discount.isNotEmpty()

createdTimeRange.descrption: Retrieves the records of the custom module based on the specified created time. The time range can be provided in ISO format !@yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ss.SSSZ@! separated by a comma.   for example, createdTimeRange=2017-11-05T00:00:00.000Z,2018-09-05T23:59:00.000Z

_all.descrption: To match throughout the all the fields !@wildcard search@!

field1.descrption: To find for values in a field, use the format !@field1=Field ApiName:search value@!. This will match the specified search values with the record’s field value and retrieve it. !@wildcard search@! !@empty check@! !@not empty check@!

field10.descrption: To find for values in a field, use the format !@field10=Field ApiName:search value@!. This will match the specified search values with the record’s field value and retrieve it. !@wildcard search@! !@empty check@! !@not empty check@!

limit.descrption: The end limit for the number of records to be fetched. For example, limit=30

field7.descrption: To find for values in a field, use the format !@field7=Field ApiName:search value@!. This will match the specified search values with the record’s field value and retrieve it. !@wildcard search@! !@empty check@! !@not empty check@!

field6.descrption: To find for values in a field, use the format !@field6=Field ApiName:search value@!. This will match the specified search values with the record’s field value and retrieve it. !@wildcard search@! !@empty check@! !@not empty check@!

from.descrption: The index number, starting from which the records must be fetched. For example, from=0.

field9.descrption: To find for values in a field, use the format !@field9=Field ApiName:search value@!. This will match the specified search values with the record’s field value and retrieve it. !@wildcard search@! !@empty check@! !@not empty check@!

modifiedTimeRange.descrption: Retrieves the records of the custom module based on the specified modified time. The time range can be provided in ISO format !@yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ss.SSSZ@! separated by a comma. for example, modifiedTimeRange=2017-11-05T00:00:00.000Z,2018-09-05T23:59:00.000Z

viewId.description: ID of the view whose record to be fetched
